entry.title: Heidi Klum Is Not Going to Dish on Her Divorce (Luckily, We Still Have Seal)

link.Abstract: Months after news of her split from Seal, Heidi Klum commented on the break-up in the new issue of Elle.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: We know it's hard to tell, but Heidi Klum here is in the eye of a tornado.

content.div:
When Heidi Klum and Seal revealed their split in January, the idea of dischord between the seven-years-married couple came as a surprise to some celeb-watchers, sure, but Seal's actions following the announcement were arguably more surprising still. No sooner had he gone public with the split, the 49-year-old singer was chatting about the break-up with the media -- discussing the end of his marriage with Ellen DeGeneres, Piers Morgan, etc.

Klum, however, has been comparatively silent -- but since the supermodel is Elle's April issue covergirl, she threw the magazine a few divorce-related soundbites -- including her take on Seal's openness with the press.

"He's going to be 50 next year. He's a grown man," Klum told Elle, "I can't tell him what to do and what not to do. It's hard."

Klum, however, told the magazine that she's taking a different approach. The 38-year-old isn't going to gab about her divorce. "I don't want to talk positively or negatively about the ups and downs that we had," Klum, who has four kids, told the magazine. "Every couple goes through things. Unfortunately, we're in the public, so the highs are out there. But I don't think it's necessary -- especially for our children -- to have the lows being printed in magazines and talked about."

But since Elle asked so nicely, she did have this to share: "I feel like I'm in the eye of the tornado," she said, regarding the gossip that accompanies a high-profile break-up. "It's emotions inside of your body that are a tornado. And then the outside world doing all this craziness -- with you wanting it or not wanting it -- is another tornado. But as hard as it is, so is life."

She continued, explaining that she'd always held the details of her marriage private -- which may account for all the OMG-ing that followed news of the couple's separation. "To the outside world, you don't really share all the things that happen. You kind of share just the most amazing sides," she said. "But I don't really want to get into any of that stuff. With my life, my family, my business -- I want to go forward."

In Seal's January interview with Piers Morgan, the "Kiss From a Rose" singer suggested that he was open to reconciling with Klum. Wearing his wedding ring on the program, Seal said: "My love for her has not waned one iota. I love her with all my heart. How can you not love somebody that you have just spent eight years with?" That said, he also acknowledge that he and Klum have "had problems."

"Otherwise, why are we splitting up? This is not a charade," Seal said. "Of course we've had problemsâ€¦We have issues. But, in our favour, I think that to our credit, we have always been able to talk about it. We have always been able to confront each other."

leahc@dose.ca
